result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: Request for Adjournment - 9/26
Pre-trial conference on September 26, 2022 at 02:10 pm.
Adams County Sheriff's Office
Re: Writ of Habeas Corpus Ad Prosequendum

Absolute sobriety from and no possession of controlled substances except prescriptions taken as prescribed.  No possession of drug paraphernalia.  Shall not drive a motor vehicle without valid driver's license.   Shall have his/her fingerprints and photograph taken at the Sheriff's Dept. Report to ATTIC Corrections Services (715-848-3202) within one business day of release. Comply with pretrial monitoring through ATTIC Correctional Services at Level (4) supervision with possible drug testing as determined by agency screening.

Clerk:  Amy. 
Called:  3:00 p.m. 
State appears by ADA Kyle Mayo.  Defendant appears in custody from Adams County Jail, via Zoom Video, and with Atty Natasha VanLieshout for Atty Fontana.  

Date and time set for warrant quash; VRCW.  
**COURT quashes warrant**

Atty VanLieshout makes statement re: defts missed appearance at prelim hearing. 
ADA Mayo advises time limits were preserved. 

BOND:  $750.00 signature bond. 

CONDITIONS: 
- Absolute sobriety from and no possession of controlled substances except prescriptions taken as prescribed.  
- No possession of drug paraphernalia. 
- No driving without valid DL. 
- Prints and photograph. 
- Report to ATTIC Corrections Services within one business day of release.  Comply with pretrial monitoring through ATTIC Correctional Services at Level 4 supervision with possible drug testing as determined by agency screening.  

PH:  9/26/22 at 9:40 a.m., Courtroom B. 

Adj:  3:03 p.m. 

Branch 3.
Public Safety Assessment_AMENDED - 9/7/22
Hearing on September 7, 2022 at 02:45 pm.

Case called: 3:07 p.m. 

State appears by ADA Kyle Mayo.  Defendant FAILS to appear.

Date and time set for Review Hearing. VRCW.  

Defendant did not appear from Wood County, the Clerk called Wood CO and they advised that the Defendant is being transported to Adams County.

Warrant to continue. 


Adjourned: 3:08 p.m.

Case Called: 9:27 am
Clerk: Kassidi.
State appears by ADA Ben Vechinski in person for ADA Rory McGarry; Defendant does not appear. Atty Adam Fontana appears in person on behalf of the Defendant.
VRCW.
Date and time set for a Preliminary Hearing.
Defendant was recently released from Wood County over the weekend on a furlough; 
Notice of hearing was sent for today's hearing to the Defendant's last known address.
Atty Fontana was unable to get in contact with the Defendant- Wood County Jail states that the Defendant is still out on Furlough and expect him to return today.
State is requesting a BW due to the Defendant's non appearance.
COURT AUTHORIZES BW $1,000.00
Court does not forfeit bond at this time.

DATES: CC 08/31/2022 @ 1:00 pm

C: Br. 3

Adj: 9:33 am
Preliminary Hearing on August 29, 2022 at 09:20 am.
Wood County Jail
Re: Writ of Habeas Corpus Ad Prosequendum

Clerk: Heather.
Case Called: 9:22 a.m. 
State appears by ADA Molly Lawrence in person. Defendant FAILS to appears, with Atty Adam Fontana in person.
Date and time set for a preliminary hearing.
VRCW. 

Atty Fontana indicates his client is in Wood Co jail and requests an adjournment.
Time limits have been previously preserved.
COURT finds good cause and tolls time limits until the next hearing.


DATES:
PRHE: 8/29/22 @ 9:20 a.m. w/CC Baumann.

Adjourned: 9:24 a.m.
